recordCreates.description: Clinical Performance in Nursing Examination (CPNE®) Clinical Examiner Evaluation Form
recordCreates.name: Create_Clinical_Examiner_Evaluation
recordCreates.label: Create Clinical Examiner Evaluation

fields.name: CA1
fields.fieldText: Clinical Associate Evaluation Form

fields.name: Directions
fields.fieldText:
Excelsior College Nursing Program,

Clinical Associate Evaluation Form


Directions: This form is to be completed by the RPAC director or CPNE® nurse faculty. In the space provided,

place a (Y) for each behavior that is met and an (N) to indicate behaviors that were not met. Please document all

pertinent examples. For any behavior that is deemed to require modification, use (RM).

fields.name: CA_Eval_Response_1
fields.fieldText: 1. Assesses examination materials for completeness and accuracy prior to submitting them to RPAC office.

fields.name: CA_Eval_Response_2
fields.fieldText: 2. Submits CPNE® examiner evaluation form(s) completed according to Excelsior College/RPAC policies.

fields.name: CA_Response_3
fields.fieldText: 3. Advises examiners regarding their compliance with examiner expected behaviors.

fields.name: CA_Response_4
fields.fieldText: 4. Exits students in a supportive manner. Provides information necessary for them to progress with their degree plans (e.g., state board information, continuing their education with Excelsior), and when deemed appropriate, provides the student with suggestions related to preparing to repeat the examination.

fields.name: CA_Response_5
fields.fieldText: 5. Records descriptive information on the CA report that completely and accurately documents pertinent test process information (i.e., failure situations, student comments related to testing, and suggestions made to students when exiting the CPNE®).

fields.name: CA_Response_6
fields.fieldText: 6. Acts as a student advocate.

fields.name: CA_Response_7
fields.fieldText: 7. Uses CA and CE protocols to make correct pass/fail decisions.

fields.name: CA_Response_8
fields.fieldText: 8. Uses feedback and evaluation to achieve identified goals.

fields.name: CA2
fields.fieldText: Clinical Associate Evaluation Form

fields.name: TestProcessManager
fields.fieldText: Test Process Manager

fields.name: CA_TP_Response1
fields.fieldText: 1. Secures, distributes, and collects all materials (equipment, forms, etc.) needed for each lab station and each PCS.

fields.name: CA_TP_Response2
fields.fieldText: 2. Orients the students to the examination within an appropriate time frame.

fields.name: CA_TP_Response3
fields.fieldText: 3. Reviews kardexes for compliance with examination protocols and appropriate patient selection, suggesting changes as needed.

fields.name: CA_TP_Respone4
fields.fieldText: 4. Maintains an environment appropriate to testing throughout the examination.

fields.name: CA_TP_Response5
fields.fieldText: 5. Conducts the examination efficiently, minimizing delays whenever possible.

fields.name: CA_TP_Response6
fields.fieldText: 6. Collaborates on pass/fail decisions according to the critical elements and test protocols, using flexibility where appropriate.

fields.name: CA_TP_Response7
fields.fieldText: 7. Allows for sufficient break time for students and examiners between PCSs.

fields.name: CA_TP_Response8
fields.fieldText: 8. Assigns fourth and fifth PCSs fairly, balancing needs of students with those of the examiners as much as possible.

fields.name: CA_TP_Response9
fields.fieldText: 9. Serves as liaison in communication and problem solving between hospital and examiners, students and examiners, and examiners and the RPAC office.

fields.name: CA_TP_Response10
fields.fieldText: 10. Verifies the accuracy and completeness of all testing materials, returning them to individual examiners as needed for correction.

fields.name: CA3
fields.fieldText: Clinical Associate Evaluation Form

fields.name: Interpersonal_Communications
fields.fieldText: Interpersonal Relations/Communications

fields.name: CA_IR_Response11
fields.fieldText: 11. Communicates time frames and necessary changes in the schedule to both students and examiners.

fields.name: CA_IR_Response12
fields.fieldText: 12. Monitors examiner behaviors throughout the examination, giving feedback to each examiner in an appropriate manner.

fields.name: CA_IR_Response13
fields.fieldText: 13. Responds to examiner and student needs during the examination.

fields.name: CA_IR_Response14
fields.fieldText: 14. Communicates with examiners, students, and staff in a professional manner.

fields.name: CA_IR_Response15
fields.fieldText: 15. Communicates rationale for decision making to the examiner when appropriate, and demonstrates respect for the examiner’s judgment.

fields.name: CA_IR_Response16
fields.fieldText: 16. Discusses potential student failures privately where participants can express themselves.

fields.name: CE1
fields.fieldText: Clinical Performance in Nursing Examination Evaluation

fields.name: CE_Directions
fields.fieldText:
Clinical Performance in Nursing Examination (CPNE®)

Clinical Examiner Evaluation Form

Directions for Clinical Associates: Use this form to document examples of exemplary CE behavior

or examples of questionable CE behavior. In the space provided for each expected behavior, place

a (Y) for behaviors that were satisfactory; use an (N) to indicate behaviors that were unsatisfactory. Discuss

the evaluation with the clinical examiner, sign the form, provide a copy to the CE, and submit original to the

RPAC office.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response1
fields.fieldText: 1. Functions as objective observer rather than as teacher during the entire clinical examination.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response2
fields.fieldText: 2. Behaves toward students in a manner intended to neutralize their anxiety and to promote objective assessment of competence.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response3
fields.fieldText: 3. Selects patients according to predetermined guidelines.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response4
fields.fieldText: 4. Prepares the PCS assignment sheet accurately and completely, and assigns appropriate areas of care within allotted time frames.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response5
fields.fieldText: 5. Prepares the patients for the PCS in a positive but neutral manner.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response6
fields.fieldText: 6. Expedites the testing process by assuring that all necessary supplies and equipment are available prior to beginning the test.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response7
fields.fieldText: 7. Evaluates students during the test by using only the specified guidelines and critical elements.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response8
fields.fieldText: 8. Observes the student at all times during the entire testing episode.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response9
fields.fieldText: 9. Documents the completion, error, or omission of each critical element during the test, as each area is being performed.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response10
fields.fieldText: 10. Allows student to correct errors unless the patient is actually, or on the verge of, being jeopardized.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response11
fields.fieldText: 11. Terminates the testing episode when necessary at the time and in the manner specified by predetermined criteria.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response12
fields.fieldText: 12. Obtains clarification and corroboration from the clinical associate prior to failing a student.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response13
fields.fieldText: 13. Completes all forms as specified as legal documentation of the test.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response14
fields.fieldText: 14. Promotes and maintains cooperative relationship with nursing staff.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response15
fields.fieldText: 15. Implements all pertinent rules and regulations related to the CPNE® and the Excelsior College Nursing Program and respects the authority of the Clinical Associate.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response16
fields.fieldText: 16. Behaves in a manner consistent with professional standards and with the philosophy of the Excelsior College Nursing Program.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response17
fields.fieldText: 17. Functions as Clinical Examiner at least once every four to six weeks (this may be altered with permission from the dean or RPAC director).

fields.name: CE_ER_Response18
fields.fieldText: 18. Verbalizes scripted statements at each designated point of the examination, including simulated labs.

fields.name: CE_ER_Response19
fields.fieldText: 19. Orients students to the clinical unit before each PCS using the Unit Orientation, including all equipment to be used during the PCS and the assigned nurse.

fields.name: CE2
fields.fieldText: Clinical Performance in Nursing Examination Evaluation

fields.name: PatientAdvocateRole
fields.fieldText: Patient Advocate Role

fields.name: CE_PA_Response20
fields.fieldText: 20. Establishes relationships with patient, patient’s family, and staff that promote the best interest of the patient.

fields.name: CE_PA_Response21
fields.fieldText: 21. Assumes full responsibility for knowing all essential aspects of the patient’s nursing care prior to beginning the test.

fields.name: CE_PA_Response22
fields.fieldText: 22. Remains with the student continuously during all aspects of care to ensure the safety and well-being of the patient.

fields.name: CE_PA_Response23
fields.fieldText: 23. Intervenes to protect the patient from actual harm or immediate threat of harm during the test period.

fields.name: CE_PA_Response24
fields.fieldText: 24. Remains aware of and attentive to the patient’s needs throughout the test episode, but interrupts the student only when absolutely necessary.

fields.name: CE_PA_Response25
fields.fieldText: 25. Assumes responsibility for assuring that the patient is left in as safe and comfortable a condition as possible, and that continuity of care is maintained through the customary oral and written reports at the conclusion of the examination.

fields.name: AdditionalRequirements
fields.fieldText: Additional Requirements

fields.name: CE_AR_Response26
fields.fieldText: 26. Annual attendance at update sessions.

fields.name: CE_AR_Response27a
fields.fieldText: 27. Involvement with students and/or new graduates as a teacher, mentor, or preceptor.

fields.name: CE_AR_Response27b
fields.fieldText: Documented continuing education in areas that pertain to the CPNE® for at least thirty contact hours every two years.

fields.name: NO_CE_CA
fields.fieldText: No Clinical Examiner or Clinical Associate was found on the Course Offering.
